2 Preliminaries: Getting Started with R Studio 2.1 Load libraries library(tm) library(tidyverse) library(wordcloud2) library(quanteda) library(tidytext)

3 Reading in a Text Corpus # read in diario adverts diario_files<-list.files(pattern=".txt") # Create corpus from diario adverts diario_adverts_corpus<-Corpus(URISource(diario_files), readerControl = list(reader=readPlain)) diario_adverts_corpus ## <<VCorpus>> ## Metadata: corpus specific: 0, document level (indexed): 0 ## Content: documents: 254
4 Creating a tidy dataframe from a text corpus
4 Creating a tidy dataframe from a text corpus diario_adverts_tidy<-tidy(diario_adverts_corpus) diario_adverts_tidy

5 Creating a word frequency table spanish_stopwords<-as.data.frame(stopwords("spanish")) diario_frequency_table<-diario_adverts_tidy %>% unnest_tokens(word, text) %>% count(word, sort=TRUE) %>% filter(!word %in% stop_words$word) %>% filter(!word %in% spanish_stopwords$`stopwords("spanish")`) diario_frequency_table_numbers<-parse_number(diario_frequency_table$word) diario_frequency_table<-cbind(diario_frequency_table, diario_frequency_table_numbers) diario_frequency_table<-diario_frequency_table %>% filter(is.na(diario_frequency_table_numbers)) diario_frequency_table<-diario_frequency_table %>% select(-diario_frequency_table_numbers) diario_frequency_table
6 Visualizing word frequency data 6.1 Charting word frequencies 6.2 Creating a word cloud

6 Visualizing word frequency data 6.1 Charting word frequencies 6.1.1 Extracting dataframe of ten most frequent words diario_top_ten<-diario_frequency_table %>% slice_max(n, n=10) diario_top_ten 6.1.2 Using ggplot2 to make chart of ten most frequent words diario_frequency_graph<- ggplot(diario_top_ten, aes(x=reorder(word, n), y=n))+ geom_bar(stat="identity")+ coord_flip()+ xlab("")+ ylab("Frequency")+ ggtitle("Ten Most Frequent Words in Diario Advertisements")+ labs(caption = "Source: El Diario Project") diario_frequency_graph 6.2 Creating a word cloud # make word cloud wordcloud2(data = df_word_frequencies, minRotation = 0, maxRotation = 0, ellipticity = 0.2)

7 Extracting bigrams diario_adverts_tidy diario_bigram<-diario_adverts_tidy %>% unnest_tokens(bigram, text, token="ngrams", n=2) %>% count(bigram, sort=TRUE) ## Warning: Outer names are only allowed for unnamed scalar atomic inputs diario_bigram diario_bigram_separated<-diario_bigram %>% separate(bigram, c("word1", "word2", sep=" ")) diario_bigram_filtered<-diario_bigram_separated %>% filter(!word1 %in% stop_words$word) %>% filter(!word2 %in% stop_words$word) remove numbers diario_bigram_word1numbers<-parse_number(diario_bigram_filtered$word1) diario_bigram_word2numbers<-parse_number(diario_bigram_filtered$word2) diario_bigram_filtered<-cbind(diario_bigram_filtered, diario_bigram_word1numbers, diario_bigram_word2numbers) diario_bigram_filtered<-diario_bigram_filtered %>% filter(is.na(diario_bigram_word1numbers)) %>% filter(is.na(diario_bigram_word2numbers)) diario_bigram_filtered_unite<-diario_bigram_filtered %>% unite(bigram, word1, word2, sep=" ") diario_bigram_filtered_unite diario_bigram_filtered_unite<-diario_bigram_filtered_unite %>% select(-c(diario_bigram_word1numbers, diario_bigram_word2numbers)) diario_bigram_filtered_unite

8 Visualizing bigrams diario_bigram_top_ten<-diario_bigram_filtered_unite %>% slice_max(n, n=10) diario_bigram_top_ten bigram_graph<- ggplot(diario_bigram_top_ten, aes(x=reorder(bigram, n), y=n))+ geom_bar(stat="identity")+ coord_flip()+ xlab("")+ ylab("Frequency")+ ggtitle("Ten Most Frequent Co-Occuring Words in Diario Advertisements")+ labs(caption = "Source: El Diario Project") bigram_graph
